page.title: 19LLANGURIG, TRANSPORT
page.content: Transport is a problem in Llangurig. The railway line closed before it became operative years ago. The Post Office operates a daily Post Bus service to and from Llanidloes, but the times are inconvenient. During the summer the National Bus Company operates a daily service to London via Cheltenham. In the winter the service is weekly. Every Monday a bus travels to Aberystwyth, and every Tuesday to Newtown market. Children from outlying farms are taxied to school, and a bus takes children to Llanidloes High School. Almost everyone relies on their own transport for general purposes.
